Summary result: Cognitive change d+≈0.36; response modulation d+≈0.16; attentional deployment d+≈0.00
Heterogeneity signal: Effects vary sharply by strategy family; some suppression forms near-zero or negative
DLN-stage interpretation (sketch): Linear suppression can reduce expression yet carry cognitive costs; network reappraisal integrates affect and supports flexibility

Summary result: IAT predictive validity r≈0.274 (explicit measures r≈0.361, but more variable)
Heterogeneity signal: Predictive validity is real but modest; substantial variation by criterion and context
DLN-stage interpretation (sketch): Linear-stage compartmentalization yields larger implicit-explicit gaps; network stage predicts tighter alignment

Summary result: Overall r≈−0.162 (alexithymia vs interoceptive awareness), with component-specific differences
Heterogeneity signal: Association depends on measurement component and sample characteristics
DLN-stage interpretation (sketch): Dot/linear stages predict decoupling between bodily signals and emotion concepts; network stage predicts stronger coupling

Summary result: HCT performance shows near-zero links with trait anxiety (r≈0.03), depression (r≈−0.04), and alexithymia (r≈−0.01)
Heterogeneity signal: Null/weak associations suggest measurement noise and construct-mismatch; encourages moderator-focused synthesis
DLN-stage interpretation (sketch): Stage effects may emerge more clearly in tasks that index integration (network) rather than raw detection under dot/linear separation

Heterogeneity signal: Moderate heterogeneity; weak overlap implies measures capture distinct components
DLN-stage interpretation (sketch): DLN predicts non-linear mapping: self-report beliefs vs performance-based integration diverge under linear compartmentalization

Summary result: Sex difference in classic 100-trial IGT UMD≈3.381 (males higher), with significant heterogeneity
Heterogeneity signal: Large between-study variability not resolved by standard moderators
DLN-stage interpretation (sketch): DLN suggests IGT outcomes depend on whether affective value signals are integrated (network) or treated as noise (linear)

Summary result: Overall health association r≈0.05 (95% CI ≈[0.003, 0.10]); domain-specific sign changes
Heterogeneity signal: Marked heterogeneity across outcomes and measures; effects can flip by health domain
DLN-stage interpretation (sketch): Network integration can make emotional processing adaptive in some domains, yet linear rumination can worsen distress
